body:
**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
The resources from cephclusters.ceph.rook.io CR stays after CR deletion 

**Expected behavior:**
Resources deletion when you delete the cephclusters.ceph.rook.io CR which include pods from this new cluster.

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
Deploy Ceph cluster following the openshift.md and the delete the CRD once all pods are on READY state.

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): CentOS Linux 7 (Core)
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 3.10.0-957.10.1.el7.x86_64
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: Libvirt
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): Master branch
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"4", Minor:"0+", GitVersion:"v4.0.22", GitCommit:"219bbe2f0c", GitTreeState:"", BuildDate:"2019-03-10T22:23:11Z", GoVersion:"", Compiler:"", Platform:""}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"13+", GitVersion:"v1.13.4+d216153", GitCommit:"d216153", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-04-07T09:36:47Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): OpenShift
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/Rook/master/toolbox.html)): `HEALTH_WARN Reduced data availability: 100 pgs inactive; clock skew detected on mon.b, mon.a`

* Reproducing the status:

```
NAME        DATADIRHOSTPATH   MONCOUNT   AGE   STATE
rook-ceph   /var/lib/rook     3          12m   Created
```

```
[jparrill@sjr3 ceph]$ oc delete cephclusters.ceph.rook.io rook-ceph
cephcluster.ceph.rook.io "rook-ceph" deleted
```

After delete the CRD the resources stays there:

```
[jparrill@sjr3 dev-scripts]$ oc get pods

rook-ceph-osd-0-54c9d6f7cf-vl5gq       0/1     CrashLoopBackOff   4          12m
```

title: Rook operator fails managing the cephclusters.ceph.rook.io CR on deletion
